column4: can someone explain to me why we have to enter ./ to run some programs?  I have googled it quite a bit but cant seem to find an answer
so even if you are running it in a directory you still have to tell it your running it in the directory and that is how it does it then?
I think I get it now.  And if more people would come in here when they have questions I don't think windoze would have any market share at all :)
means say um the app is in say Documents well you would   cd Documents/appdir/ && ./app
